place.name: REDWICK
place.gazetteerText: REDWICK, a chapelry in Magor parish, Monmouth; on the coast of Caldicot level, 2 miles S S W of Magor r.station, and 7 E S E of Newport. Post-town, Magor, under Chepstow. Acres, 7, 794; of which 5, 560 are water. Real property, £4, 319. Pop., 289. Houses, 50. The property is subdivided. The living is annexed to the vicarage of Magor in the diocese of Llandaff. The church is good; and there is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
